page.title: 05 Great Haseley - Backway
page.content: Backway is an unmade road behind the school.It joins Rectory Road at two places.In Backway there are several old stone cottages,including the "Stoneyard" where stones were prepared for memorials and buildings at one time.School House is also there and in addition Old School House,once a girls school. There are two new houses,a greengrocers store (open on Saturdays only) and the School Swimming Pool.The Old Chapel is now the Horticultural Society Store. Lewington Close,off Backway consists of 10 semi-detached houses built in a former farmyard in 1973.The houses are brick built local authority houses now privately owned.Lewington was a landowner in Haseley. by Stephen Stratford.
